meanings.definition: To discipline or punish in order to correct behavior.
meanings.sent1: The teacher had to chasten the student for talking during the test.
meanings.sent2: Parents sometimes need to chasten their children to teach them right from wrong.
meanings.sent3: After being chastened for not doing his homework, Tim learned his lesson.
meanings.sent4: The failure chastened him to work harder next time.
meanings.sent5: The coach's stern look was enough to chasten the players into focusing on the game.

meanings.definition: To make someone feel remorse or regret for their actions.
meanings.sent1: The consequences of his actions chastened him deeply.
meanings.sent2: Her words were meant to chasten him for his thoughtless behavior.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's guilty eyes seemed to chasten its owner for leaving it alone.
meanings.sent4: The loss of the game chastened the team and made them reflect on their mistakes.
meanings.sent5: The sad ending of the movie chastened the audience and left them pondering its message.
